channel.title: The Alice Alignment Push Test
channel.description:
So while playing a game with @Arete they brought up my meta when it comes to pushes and I decided to check out a few past games where I mislynched/tried to mislynch villagers as both alignments. Here are posts from each day where I pushed lynches on villas, by mistake as V and intentionally as W.
Here's a challenge for ya, read each of these statements and try to guess whether they come from V!Me who mistakenly wolfread villager X or W!Me who's trying to push villager X for a mislynch.
--- 1. ‚ÄúHmmm, looks like she's at the point where she can make genuine-sounding reads as a wolf but can't fake a progression on them.‚Äù
2. ‚ÄúCan we just yeet X today? I seen no reason why not do it today since nobody has any idea for an alternative lynch.‚Äù
3. ‚ÄúOn one hand at least both your claims look to be corroborating each other so I don't think either of you are faking it. On the other‚Ä¶‚Äù
4. ‚ÄúI‚Äôm basically full on the X lynch as his perspective has repeatedly shown that he does have TMI in this case.‚Äù
5. X/Y have basically been useless, tbh. Would go X>Y being that X just keeps posting excuses why he hasn‚Äôt made any analysis while Y‚Äôs first inquiry into Z felt kind of villagery.
6. ‚ÄúI frankly want to lynch X rn being that he looks extremely detached from the game considering that he's just floating around at an EoD when we're at XYLO-1.‚Äú
7. ‚ÄúI meant I was hesitating earlier on her because on this site villas do dumb shit like write LAMIST clusterfucks or try to negate town reads for no reason. I just don‚Äôt think her read on W/Y/Z is ever genuine.‚Äù
8. ‚ÄúX looks frozen as hell. Kind of wanting Y/X wagons as Z actually dealt with pressure relatively well.‚Äù
9. ‚ÄúActually, X wolf/Y village makes the most sense in respect to the gamestate with Z taking his vote off Y. She should be the day's lynch unless she claims [PR].‚Äù
10. ‚ÄúX‚Äôs read on me distancing from Y was tbh pretty bad and artificial. I was repeatedly townreading Y and she doesn‚Äôt further elaborate than this. Also of course I‚Äôm going to have bland posts at the SoD as I have trouble creating content from nothing.‚Äù
11. ‚ÄúThinking it may be just X by now being that there really isn‚Äôt any reason not to clear Y here unless they want to do it solely to expand the PoE.‚Äù
12. ‚ÄúIt should be obvious that this post is ridiculously performative.‚Äù
13. ‚Äú‚Ä¶that‚Äôs follow-up. The point is that I‚Äôm suspecting x as he hasn‚Äôt really done anything read-wise and spent much of the time theorizing about classes and trying to role-fish. Him making these odd deductions on Y is basically just another reason why I‚Äôm suspicious of him.‚Äù

item.dc:creator: Marshal
item.description:
microreads on specific posts can work but usually they‚Äôre still supplemented by macroreads and also fishing out a random post and microreading it will get you virtually nowhere, its only specifc posts that can be microread to a significantly beneficial degreee

item.title: The Alice Alignment Push Test
item.dc:creator: katze
item.description:
okay last ones

how do you get any information on X‚Äôs alignment by their interactions with somebody who they have a 0% chance of knowing the alignment of?

id say their ISO is >rand wolf just because it‚Äôs useless, but that doesnt seem uncommon here?

if this is unheard of from them, it could be an attempt to overcompensate? but id have to read more of their games to give you a specific ‚ÄúX is a villager‚Äù read as opposed to ‚Äúthe posts coming from Xs slot are posts that are >rand V‚Äù

Read full topic

Like if someone claims a unique PR, you instantly CC them because that‚Äôs basically openwolfing.

item.title: The Alice Alignment Push Test
item.dc:creator: Arctic
item.description:
my honest opinion is that microreads do not actually exist in the context of a game

it‚Äôs nearly impossible and in no way optimal to try and assess a post without allowing the context surrounding said post to affect your judgement

the fact that you‚Äôre inherently biased by the context of the post means you aren‚Äôt actually doing a microread

If you somehow did manage to remove all context and subjective bias resulting from such context, that leaves you with the situation that we‚Äôve proved in this thread that microreads are bad

Not removing the context means that you aren‚Äôt microreading

so you are either not microreading
or you are microreading and it‚Äôs not good

Read full topic

item.title: The Alice Alignment Push Test
item.dc:creator: katze
item.description:
microreads don‚Äôt suck they‚Äôre just not an end-all way to read people

but i fully believe that there are posts that are so incredibly AI that i can disregard an entire ISO and say ‚Äúthis post is why X player is Y alignment‚Äù

and while those posts are commonly longer posts i‚Äôm p sure i‚Äôve done this with small posts

like gorta in half his games

Read full topic

item.title: The Alice Alignment Push Test
item.dc:creator: Arctic
item.description:
if we‚Äôve learnt anything from this it‚Äôs that microreads suck

people consistently randing their guesses or putting town for all of them perform just as well as people actually trying

Read full topic
